tit.cmt: タイトルなので大文字にしました。

sen.j: 飯尾氏（いのおうじ/いいおし）
sen.e: Inoo clan, also known as Iio clan
Inoo clan, also known as Iio clan
Inoo clan, also known as Iio clan
Suruga Inoo clan
Suruga Inoo clan
Suruga Inoo clan
Descendants of Tameyasu MIYOSHI
Descendants of Tameyasu MIYOSHI
Descendants of Tameyasu MIYOSHI
Inoo clan of the Oda clan line
Inoo clan of the Oda clan line
Inoo clan of the Oda clan line

tit.j: 駿河飯尾氏（幕府相伴衆）
tit.e: Suruga Inoo clan which served as a private guard of the shogun
Suruga Inoo clan which served as a private guard of the shogun
Suruga Inoo clan which served as a private guard of the shogun

sen.e: The original name was the Miyoshi clan.
The original name was the Miyoshi clan.
The original name was the Miyoshi clan.

sen.j: 三善倫忠の代に飯尾姓を名乗った。
sen.e: From the generation of Tomotada MIYOSHI, the family adopted the name Inoo.
From the generation of Tomotada MIYOSHI, the family adopted the name Inoo.
From the generation of Tomotada MIYOSHI, the family adopted the name Inoo.

sen.j: 元々は室町幕府の相伴衆の家柄であったが、飯尾長連の代に駿河に下り、今川氏譜代の家臣となった。
sen.e: The family originally served as a private guard of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) for successive generations, but in the generation of Nagatsura INOO, they went down to Suruga and became a hereditary vassal of the Imagawa clan.

The family originally served as a private guard of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) for successive generations, but in the generation of Nagatsura INOO, they went down to Suruga and became a hereditary vassal of the Imagawa clan.

The family originally served as a private guard of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) for successive generations, but in the generation of Nagatsura INOO, they went down to Suruga and became a hereditary vassal of the Imagawa clan.

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)、飯尾賢連は今川氏親に仕え、引馬城（後の浜松城）主となった。
sen.e: During the Warring States period, Katatsura INOO served Ujichika IMAGAWA and became the lord of Hikuma-jo Castle, which was called Hamatsu-jo Castle later.
During the Warring States period, Katatsura INOO served Ujichika IMAGAWA and became the lord of Hikuma-jo Castle, which was called Hamamatsu-jo Castle later.
During the Warring States period, Katatsura INOO served Ujichika IMAGAWA and became the lord of Hikuma-jo Castle, which was called Hamamatsu-jo Castle later.

sen.j: 賢連の子飯尾乗連は今川義元に桶狭間の戦いで従軍し、討ち死にした。
sen.e: Noritsura INOO, a son of Katatsura, joined the army of Yoshimoto IMAGAWA in the Battle of Okehazama and died in the battlefield.
Noritsura INOO, a son of Katatsura, joined the army of Yoshimoto IMAGAWA in the Battle of Okehazama and died in the battlefield.
Noritsura INOO, a son of Katatsura, joined the army of Yoshimoto IMAGAWA in the Battle of Okehazama and died in the battlefield.

sen.j: 乗連の子飯尾連竜は初め義元の跡を受けて家督を継いだ今川氏真に仕えたが、三河の徳川氏に内通し、今川氏から離反した。
sen.e: Tsuratatsu INOO, a son of Noritsura, initially served Ujizane IMAGAWA, who succeeded Yoshimoto IMAGAWA, but communicated secretly with the Tokugawa clan in Mikawa and defected from the Imagawa clan.
Tsuratatsu INOO, a son of Noritsura, initially served Ujizane IMAGAWA, who succeeded Yoshimoto IMAGAWA, but communicated secretly with the Tokugawa clan in Mikawa and defected from the Imagawa clan.
Tsuratatsu INOO, a son of Noritsura, initially served Ujizane IMAGAWA, who succeeded Yoshimoto IMAGAWA, but communicated secretly with the Tokugawa clan in Mikawa and defected from the Imagawa clan.

sen.j: その後、今川氏真は和睦と偽って連竜を召喚して誅殺し、駿河飯尾氏の嫡流は断絶した。
sen.e: Later, Ujizane IMAGAWA called back Tsuratatsu on the pretext of reconciliation and killed Tsuratatsu, which was the end of the direct descendant of the Suruga Inoo clan.
Later, Ujizane IMAGAWA called back Tsuratatsu on the pretext of reconciliation and killed Tsuratatsu, which was the end of the direct descendant of the Suruga Inoo clan.
Later, Ujizane IMAGAWA called back Tsuratatsu on the pretext of reconciliation and killed Tsuratatsu, which was the end of the direct descendant of the Suruga Inoo clan.

tit.e: Inoo clan of the Oda clan line
Inoo clan of the Oda clan line
Inoo clan of the Oda clan line

sen.j: 織田氏の一族織田敏定の孫が尾張の土豪飯尾氏の養子となり、飯尾定宗と名乗ったことに始まる。
sen.e: This family line began when a grandson of Toshisada ODA from the Oda clan was adopted into the INOO clan, a powerful local clan in Owari, and changed his name to Sadamune INOO (also pronounced IINOO).

This family line began when a grandson of Toshisada ODA from the Oda clan was adopted into the Inoo clan, a powerful local clan in Owari, and changed his name to Sadamune INOO (also pronounced IINOO).

This family line began when a grandson of Toshisada ODA from the Oda clan was adopted into the Inoo clan, a powerful local clan in Owari, and changed his name to Sadamune INOO (also pronounced IINOO).

sen.j: 飯尾定宗は織田信長に仕え、桶狭間の戦いで討ち死にした。
sen.e: Sadamune INOO served Nobunaga ODA and died in the battlefield of Okehazama.
Sadamune INOO served Nobunaga ODA and died in the battlefield of Okehazama.
Sadamune INOO served Nobunaga ODA and died in the battlefield of Okehazama.

sen.j: 定宗の跡を継いだ飯尾尚清は赤母衣衆となり、本能寺の変後、織田信雄、さらに豊臣秀吉に仕えた。
sen.e: Hisakiyo INOO (also pronounced IIO) who succeeded Sadamune became a member of an elite troop of the Oda family called Akahoroshu, and after the Incident at Honnoji, served Nobukatsu ODA and then Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

Hisakiyo INOO (also pronounced IIO) who succeeded Sadamune became a member of an elite troop of the Oda family called Akahoroshu, and after the Incident at Honnoji, served Nobukatsu ODA and then Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

Hisakiyo INOO (also pronounced IIO) who succeeded Sadamune became a member of an elite troop of the Oda family called Akahoroshu, and after the Incident at Honnoji, served Nobukatsu ODA and then Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 嫡子敏成は尚清の死にさきだって亡くなっていたため、嫡流は断絶したが、弟の重宗の系統が続いた。
sen.e: As Toshinari, the heir to Hisakiyo, died prior to Hisakiyo, the direct descendant of the Inoo clan of the Oda clan line ended here, but Hisakiyo's younger brother Shigemune's line continued.
As Toshinari, the heir to Hisakiyo, died prior to Hisakiyo, the direct descendant of the Inoo clan of the Oda clan line ended here, but Hisakiyo's younger brother Shigemune's line continued.
As Toshinari, the heir to Hisakiyo, died prior to Hisakiyo, the direct descendant of the Inoo clan of the Oda clan line ended here, but Hisakiyo's younger brother Shigemune's line continued.
